properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM; Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20 NM; Matagorda Bay; Galveston Bay
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 13 at 2:05PM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
Warm and moist air flowing over cooler shelf waters will lead to
episodes of sea fog tonight and Tuesday. The fog is expected to
become locally dense at times and visibility will likely fall
below a mile over parts of Galveston Bay, Matagorda Bay and the
adjacent near shore waters. At 2 PM, visibility at several marine
reporting stations showed fog already developing with visibility
between 2 and 3 miles. Fog is expected to become more widespread
and locally dense after sunset. A Marine Dense Fog Advisory will
probably be required later tonight and the Advisory will likely be
in effect through Tuesday morning. Mariners are urged to use
caution tonight and be prepared for rapidly changing visibility.
